title: Pass the AUX
summary: Pass the AUX is a social music controller app for iOS where multiple people can play music to a shared "room".
tech_stack: Javascript, NodeJS, MongoDB, Spotify Web API, socket.io
responsibilities: I served as the sole backend developer for this project, working with my friend Evan who developed the frontend in Swift. I created a NodeJS server that allowed users to play music to a shared "room". The server also communicated with Spotify's Player API to synchronize playback between users' devices. I gained experience using socket.io which was used in my first implementation, but then was later scrapped.
description: A social music controller for iOS
highlights: Built an Express.js server with REST API and MongoDB database
Experimented implementation with socket.io for real time updates to client application
Implemented push notifications with Apple's APNS and Google Firebase

title: neildevas.com
summary: neildevas.com is a portfolio website I built for myself to showcase past experiences and work history.
tech_stack: React, GatsbyJS, Adobe XD, Adobe Photoshop, TailwindCSS
responsibilities: Learned UI/UX design and Adobe Photoshop from a Udemy course and learned GatsbyJS framework to create a personal website.
description: This beautiful site you are looking at right now
highlights: Self-taught UI/UX design with Adobe XD and designed website from scratch
